summary: This is an email from a paralegal specialist at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the SDNY regarding document production in the case U.S. v. Maxwell. It details the locations of Rule 16, 3500, and GX productions, notes the addition of three previously unproduced pages from Interlochen records, and includes attached indices and cover letters.

persons.name: Paralegal Specialist
persons.role: Paralegal Specialist at U.S. Attorney's Office
persons.context: The sender of the email, responsible for managing and coordinating the document production for the U.S. v. Maxwell case, including checking records and loading drives.

events.title: Document Production for U.S. v. Maxwell
events.description: A paralegal specialist emails colleagues to inform them that Rule 16, 3500, and GX productions have been saved to specific network locations, and that three additional pages from Interlochen records have been added to the production.

keyFacts: The document is an internal email regarding evidence production in the criminal case U.S. v. Maxwell.
It references the addition of three previously unproduced pages from 'Interlochen records' (likely related to Interlochen Arts Academy) to the discovery materials.
The email details specific network storage locations for Rule 16, witness (3500), and government exhibit (GX) productions.
The correspondence indicates an ongoing, organized process of evidence sharing between prosecution and defense teams in late 2021.
